1.verse: Give ear to my words, Yahweh.

1.verse: I love you, Yahweh, my strength.

4.verse: The cords of death surrounded me.

6.verse: In my distress I called on Yahweh,

7.verse: Then the earth shook and trembled.

8.verse: Smoke went out of his nostrils.

9.verse: He bowed the heavens also, and came down.

10.verse: He rode on a cherub, and flew.

11.verse: He made darkness his hiding place, his pavilion around him,

12.verse: At the brightness before him his thick clouds passed,

13.verse: Yahweh also thundered in the sky.

14.verse: He sent out his arrows, and scattered them.

15.verse: Then the channels of waters appeared.

16.verse: He sent from on high.

17.verse: Lord, how long will you look on?

18.verse: I will give you thanks in the great assembly.

20.verse: For they don’t speak peace,

21.verse: Yes, they opened their mouth wide against me.

22.verse: You have seen it, Yahweh. Don’t keep silent.

23.verse: Wake up! Rise up to defend me, my God!

24.verse: Vindicate me, Yahweh my God, according to your righteousness.

26.verse: Let them be disappointed and confounded together who rejoice at my calamity.

1.verse: A revelation is within my heart about the disobedience of the wicked:

2.verse: For he flatters himself in his own eyes,

3.verse: The words of his mouth are iniquity and deceit.

4.verse: He plots iniquity on his bed.

5.verse: Your loving kindness, Yahweh, is in the heavens.

6.verse: Your righteousness is like the mountains of God.

7.verse: How precious is your loving kindness, God!

8.verse: They shall be abundantly satisfied with the abundance of your house.

9.verse: For with you is the spring of life.

10.verse: Oh continue your loving kindness to those who know you,

11.verse: Don’t let the foot of pride come against me.

1.verse: Don’t fret because of evildoers,

2.verse: For they shall soon be cut down like the grass,

3.verse: Trust in Yahweh, and do good.

4.verse: Also delight yourself in Yahweh,

5.verse: Commit your way to Yahweh.

6.verse: he will make your righteousness shine out like light,

7.verse: Rest in Yahweh, and wait patiently for him.

8.verse: Cease from anger, and forsake wrath.

9.verse: For evildoers shall be cut off,

10.verse: For yet a little while, and the wicked will be no more.

11.verse: But the humble shall inherit the land,

12.verse: The wicked plots against the just,

13.verse: The Lord will laugh at him,

14.verse: The wicked have drawn out the sword, and have bent their bow,

24.verse: Though he stumble, he shall not fall,

25.verse: I have been young, and now am old,

26.verse: All day long he deals graciously, and lends.

1.verse: Yahweh, don’t rebuke me in your wrath,

3.verse: There is no soundness in my flesh because of your indignation,

6.verse: I am in pain and bowed down greatly.

1.verse: I said, “I will watch my ways, so that I don’t sin with my tongue.

1.verse: As the deer pants for the water brooks,

1.verse: We have heard with our ears, God;

35.verse: You are awesome, God, in your sanctuaries.

1.verse: Save me, God,

2.verse: I sink in deep mire, where there is no foothold.

3.verse: I am weary with my crying.

4.verse: Those who hate me without a cause are more than the hairs of my head.

5.verse: God, you know my foolishness.

6.verse: Don’t let those who wait for you be shamed through me, Lord Yahweh of Armies.

7.verse: Because for your sake, I have borne reproach.

8.verse: I have become a stranger to my brothers,

9.verse: For the zeal of your house consumes me.

10.verse: When I wept and I fasted,

11.verse: When I made sackcloth my clothing,

12.verse: Those who sit in the gate talk about me.

13.verse: But as for me, my prayer is to you, Yahweh, in an acceptable time.

14.verse: Deliver me out of the mire, and don’t let me sink.

15.verse: Don’t let the flood waters overwhelm me,

16.verse: Answer me, Yahweh, for your loving kindness is good.

17.verse: Don’t hide your face from your servant,

18.verse: Draw near to my soul and redeem it.

19.verse: You know my reproach, my shame, and my dishonor.

20.verse: Reproach has broken my heart, and I am full of heaviness.

21.verse: They also gave me poison for my food.

22.verse: Let their table before them become a snare.

23.verse: Let their eyes be darkened, so that they can’t see.

24.verse: Pour out your indignation on them.

26.verse: For they persecute him whom you have wounded.

27.verse: Charge them with crime upon crime.

28.verse: Let them be blotted out of the book of life,

29.verse: But I am in pain and distress.

30.verse: I will praise the name of God with a song,

31.verse: It will please Yahweh better than an ox,

32.verse: The humble have seen it, and are glad.

34.verse: Let heaven and earth praise him;

35.verse: For God will save Zion, and build the cities of Judah.

36.verse: The children also of his servants shall inherit it.

1.verse: Hurry, God, to deliver me.

2.verse: Let them be disappointed and confounded who seek my soul.

3.verse: Let them be turned because of their shame

4.verse: Let all those who seek you rejoice and be glad in you.

5.verse: But I am poor and needy.

1.verse: In you, Yahweh, I take refuge.

2.verse: Deliver me in your righteousness, and rescue me.

3.verse: Be to me a rock of refuge to which I may always go.

4.verse: Rescue me, my God, from the hand of the wicked,

5.verse: For you are my hope, Lord Yahweh,

6.verse: I have relied on you from the womb.

7.verse: I am a marvel to many,

8.verse: My mouth shall be filled with your praise,

9.verse: Don’t reject me in my old age.

10.verse: For my enemies talk about me.

11.verse: saying, “God has forsaken him.

12.verse: God, don’t be far from me.

13.verse: Let my accusers be disappointed and consumed.

14.verse: But I will always hope,

15.verse: My mouth will tell about your righteousness,

16.verse: I will come with the mighty acts of the Lord Yahweh.

17.verse: God, you have taught me from my youth.

18.verse: Yes, even when I am old and gray-haired, God, don’t forsake me,

19.verse: God, your righteousness also reaches to the heavens.

20.verse: You, who have shown us many and bitter troubles,

21.verse: Increase my honor

22.verse: I will also praise you with the harp for your faithfulness, my God.

23.verse: My lips shall shout for joy!

24.verse: My tongue will also talk about your righteousness all day long,

1.verse: God, give the king your justice;

2.verse: He will judge your people with righteousness,

3.verse: The mountains shall bring prosperity to the people.

4.verse: He will judge the poor of the people.

5.verse: They shall fear you while the sun endures;

6.verse: He will come down like rain on the mown grass,

7.verse: In his days, the righteous shall flourish,

8.verse: He shall have dominion also from sea to sea,

9.verse: Those who dwell in the wilderness shall bow before him.

10.verse: The kings of Tarshish and of the islands will bring tribute.

11.verse: Yes, all kings shall fall down before him.

12.verse: For he will deliver the needy when he cries;

13.verse: He will have pity on the poor and needy.

14.verse: He will redeem their soul from oppression and violence.

15.verse: They shall live, and to him shall be given of the gold of Sheba.

16.verse: Abundance of grain shall be throughout the land.

17.verse: His name endures forever.

18.verse: Praise be to Yahweh God, the God of Israel,

19.verse: Blessed be his glorious name forever!

20.verse: This ends the prayers by David, the son of Jesse.

1.verse: Surely God is good to Israel,

2.verse: But as for me, my feet were almost gone.

3.verse: For I was envious of the arrogant,

4.verse: For there are no struggles in their death,

5.verse: They are free from burdens of men,

6.verse: Therefore pride is like a chain around their neck.

7.verse: Their eyes bulge with fat.

8.verse: They scoff and speak with malice.

9.verse: They have set their mouth in the heavens.

10.verse: Therefore their people return to them,

11.verse: They say, “How does God know?

12.verse: Behold, these are the wicked.

13.verse: Surely I have cleansed my heart in vain,

14.verse: For all day long I have been plagued,

15.verse: If I had said, “I will speak thus”;

16.verse: When I tried to understand this,

17.verse: until I entered God’s sanctuary,

18.verse: Surely you set them in slippery places.

19.verse: How they are suddenly destroyed!

20.verse: As a dream when one wakes up,

21.verse: For my soul was grieved.

22.verse: I was so senseless and ignorant.

23.verse: Nevertheless, I am continually with you.

24.verse: You will guide me with your counsel,

25.verse: Whom do I have in heaven?

26.verse: My flesh and my heart fails,

27.verse: For, behold, those who are far from you shall perish.

28.verse: But it is good for me to come close to God.

1.verse: God, why have you rejected us forever?

2.verse: Remember your congregation, which you purchased of old,

3.verse: Lift up your feet to the perpetual ruins,

4.verse: Your adversaries have roared in the middle of your assembly.

5.verse: They behaved like men wielding axes,

6.verse: Now they break all its carved work down with hatchet and hammers.

7.verse: They have burned your sanctuary to the ground.

8.verse: They said in their heart, “We will crush them completely.”

9.verse: We see no miraculous signs.

10.verse: How long, God, shall the adversary reproach?

11.verse: Why do you draw back your hand, even your right hand?

12.verse: Yet God is my King of old,

13.verse: You divided the sea by your strength.

14.verse: You broke the heads of Leviathan in pieces.

15.verse: You opened up spring and stream.

16.verse: The day is yours, the night is also yours.

17.verse: You have set all the boundaries of the earth.

18.verse: Remember this, that the enemy has mocked you, Yahweh.

19.verse: Don’t deliver the soul of your dove to wild beasts.

20.verse: Honor your covenant,

21.verse: Don’t let the oppressed return ashamed.

22.verse: Arise, God! Plead your own cause.

23.verse: Don’t forget the voice of your adversaries.

1.verse: We give thanks to you, God.

2.verse: When I choose the appointed time,

3.verse: The earth and all its inhabitants quake.

4.verse: I said to the arrogant, “Don’t boast!”

5.verse: Don’t lift up your horn on high.

6.verse: For neither from the east, nor from the west,

7.verse: But God is the judge.

8.verse: For in Yahweh’s hand there is a cup,

9.verse: But I will declare this forever:

10.verse: I will cut off all the horns of the wicked,

1.verse: In Judah, God is known.

2.verse: His tabernacle is also in Salem;

3.verse: There he broke the flaming arrows of the bow,

4.verse: Glorious are you, and excellent,

5.verse: Valiant men lie plundered,

6.verse: At your rebuke, God of Jacob,

7.verse: You, even you, are to be feared.

8.verse: You pronounced judgment from heaven.

9.verse: when God arose to judgment,

10.verse: Surely the wrath of man praises you.

11.verse: Make vows to Yahweh your God, and fulfill them!

12.verse: He will cut off the spirit of princes.

1.verse: My cry goes to God!

2.verse: In the day of my trouble I sought the Lord.

3.verse: I remember God, and I groan.

4.verse: You hold my eyelids open.

5.verse: I have considered the days of old,

6.verse: I remember my song in the night.

7.verse: “Will the Lord reject us forever?

8.verse: Has his loving kindness vanished forever?

9.verse: Has God forgotten to be gracious?

10.verse: Then I thought, “I will appeal to this:

11.verse: I will remember Yah’s deeds;

12.verse: I will also meditate on all your work,

13.verse: Your way, God, is in the sanctuary.

14.verse: You are the God who does wonders.

15.verse: You have redeemed your people with your arm,

16.verse: The waters saw you, God.

17.verse: The clouds poured out water.

18.verse: The voice of your thunder was in the whirlwind.

19.verse: Your way was through the sea;

20.verse: You led your people like a flock,

1.verse: Hear my teaching, my people.

2.verse: I will open my mouth in a parable.

3.verse: Which we have heard and known,

4.verse: We will not hide them from their children,

5.verse: For he established a covenant in Jacob,

6.verse: that the generation to come might know, even the children who should be born;

7.verse: that they might set their hope in God,

8.verse: and might not be as their fathers,

9.verse: The children of Ephraim, being armed and carrying bows,

10.verse: They didn’t keep God’s covenant,

11.verse: They forgot his doings,

12.verse: He did marvelous things in the sight of their fathers,

13.verse: He split the sea, and caused them to pass through.

14.verse: In the daytime he also led them with a cloud,

15.verse: He split rocks in the wilderness,

16.verse: He brought streams also out of the rock,

17.verse: Yet they still went on to sin against him,

18.verse: They tempted God in their heart

19.verse: Yes, they spoke against God.

20.verse: Behold, he struck the rock, so that waters gushed out,

21.verse: Therefore Yahweh heard, and was angry.

22.verse: because they didn’t believe in God,

23.verse: Yet he commanded the skies above,

24.verse: He rained down manna on them to eat,

25.verse: Man ate the bread of angels.

26.verse: He caused the east wind to blow in the sky.

27.verse: He also rained meat on them as the dust,

28.verse: He let them fall in the middle of their camp,

29.verse: So they ate, and were well filled.

30.verse: They didn’t turn from their cravings.

31.verse: when the anger of God went up against them,

32.verse: For all this they still sinned,

33.verse: Therefore he consumed their days in vanity,

34.verse: When he killed them, then they inquired after him.

35.verse: They remembered that God was their rock,

36.verse: But they flattered him with their mouth,

37.verse: For their heart was not right with him,

38.verse: But he, being merciful, forgave iniquity, and didn’t destroy them.

39.verse: He remembered that they were but flesh,

40.verse: How often they rebelled against him in the wilderness,

41.verse: They turned again and tempted God,

43.verse: how he set his signs in Egypt,

44.verse: he turned their rivers into blood,

45.verse: He sent among them swarms of flies, which devoured them;

46.verse: He also gave their increase to the caterpillar,

47.verse: He destroyed their vines with hail,

48.verse: He also gave over their livestock to the hail,

49.verse: He threw on them the fierceness of his anger,

50.verse: He made a path for his anger.

51.verse: and struck all the firstborn in Egypt,

52.verse: But he led out his own people like sheep,

53.verse: He led them safely, so that they weren’t afraid,

54.verse: He brought them to the border of his sanctuary,

55.verse: He also drove out the nations before them,

56.verse: Yet they tempted and rebelled against the Most High God,

57.verse: but turned back, and dealt treacherously like their fathers.

58.verse: For they provoked him to anger with their high places,

59.verse: When God heard this, he was angry,

60.verse: so that he abandoned the tent of Shiloh,

61.verse: and delivered his strength into captivity,

62.verse: He also gave his people over to the sword,

64.verse: Their priests fell by the sword,

65.verse: Then the Lord awakened as one out of sleep,

67.verse: Moreover he rejected the tent of Joseph,

68.verse: But chose the tribe of Judah,

69.verse: He built his sanctuary like the heights,

70.verse: He also chose David his servant,

71.verse: from following the ewes that have their young,

72.verse: So he was their shepherd according to the integrity of his heart,

1.verse: God, the nations have come into your inheritance.

2.verse: They have given the dead bodies of your servants to be food for the birds of the sky,

3.verse: They have shed their blood like water around Jerusalem.

4.verse: We have become a reproach to our neighbors,

5.verse: How long, Yahweh?

6.verse: Pour out your wrath on the nations that don’t know you,

7.verse: for they have devoured Jacob,

8.verse: Don’t hold the iniquities of our forefathers against us.

9.verse: Help us, God of our salvation, for the glory of your name.

10.verse: Why should the nations say, “Where is their God?”

11.verse: Let the sighing of the prisoner come before you.

12.verse: Pay back to our neighbors seven times into their bosom

13.verse: So we, your people and sheep of your pasture,

1.verse: Hear us, Shepherd of Israel,

2.verse: Before Ephraim and Benjamin and Manasseh, stir up your might!

3.verse: Turn us again, God.

4.verse: Yahweh God of Armies,

5.verse: You have fed them with the bread of tears,

6.verse: You make us a source of contention to our neighbors.

7.verse: Turn us again, God of Armies.

8.verse: You brought a vine out of Egypt.

9.verse: You cleared the ground for it.

10.verse: The mountains were covered with its shadow.

11.verse: It sent out its branches to the sea,

12.verse: Why have you broken down its walls,

13.verse: The boar out of the wood ravages it.

14.verse: Turn again, we beg you, God of Armies.

15.verse: the stock which your right hand planted,

16.verse: It’s burned with fire.

17.verse: Let your hand be on the man of your right hand,

18.verse: So we will not turn away from you.

19.verse: Turn us again, Yahweh God of Armies.

1.verse: Sing aloud to God, our strength!

2.verse: Raise a song, and bring here the tambourine,

3.verse: Blow the trumpet at the New Moon,

4.verse: For it is a statute for Israel,

5.verse: He appointed it in Joseph for a covenant,

6.verse: “I removed his shoulder from the burden.

7.verse: You called in trouble, and I delivered you.

8.verse: “Hear, my people, and I will testify to you,

9.verse: There shall be no strange god in you,

10.verse: I am Yahweh, your God,

11.verse: But my people didn’t listen to my voice.

12.verse: So I let them go after the stubbornness of their hearts,

13.verse: Oh that my people would listen to me,

14.verse: I would soon subdue their enemies,

15.verse: The haters of Yahweh would cringe before him,

16.verse: But he would have also fed them with the finest of the wheat.

1.verse: God presides in the great assembly.

2.verse: “How long will you judge unjustly,

5.verse: They don’t know, neither do they understand.

6.verse: I said, “You are gods,

7.verse: Nevertheless you shall die like men,

1.verse: God, don’t keep silent.

2.verse: For, behold, your enemies are stirred up.

3.verse: They conspire with cunning against your people.

4.verse: “Come,” they say, “let’s destroy them as a nation,

5.verse: For they have conspired together with one mind.

6.verse: The tents of Edom and the Ishmaelites;

7.verse: Gebal, Ammon, and Amalek;

8.verse: Assyria also is joined with them.

9.verse: Do to them as you did to Midian,

10.verse: who perished at Endor,

11.verse: Make their nobles like Oreb and Zeeb,

12.verse: who said, “Let’s take possession of God’s pasture lands.”

13.verse: My God, make them like tumbleweed,

14.verse: As the fire that burns the forest,

15.verse: so pursue them with your tempest,

16.verse: Fill their faces with confusion,

17.verse: Let them be disappointed and dismayed forever.

18.verse: that they may know that you alone, whose name is Yahweh,

1.verse: How lovely are your dwellings,

2.verse: My soul longs, and even faints for the courts of Yahweh.

3.verse: Yes, the sparrow has found a home,

4.verse: Blessed are those who dwell in your house.

5.verse: Blessed are those whose strength is in you,

6.verse: Passing through the valley of Weeping, they make it a place of springs.

7.verse: They go from strength to strength.

8.verse: Yahweh, God of Armies, hear my prayer.

9.verse: Behold, God our shield,

10.verse: For a day in your courts is better than a thousand.

11.verse: For Yahweh God is a sun and a shield.

12.verse: Yahweh of Armies,

1.verse: Yahweh, you have been favorable to your land.

2.verse: You have forgiven the iniquity of your people.

3.verse: You have taken away all your wrath.

4.verse: Turn us, God of our salvation,

5.verse: Will you be angry with us forever?

6.verse: Won’t you revive us again,

7.verse: Show us your loving kindness, Yahweh.

8.verse: I will hear what God, Yahweh, will speak,

9.verse: Surely his salvation is near those who fear him,

10.verse: Mercy and truth meet together.

11.verse: Truth springs out of the earth.

12.verse: Yes, Yahweh will give that which is good.

13.verse: Righteousness goes before him,

1.verse: Hear, Yahweh, and answer me,

2.verse: Preserve my soul, for I am godly.

3.verse: Be merciful to me, Lord,

4.verse: Bring joy to the soul of your servant,

5.verse: For you, Lord, are good, and ready to forgive,

6.verse: Hear, Yahweh, my prayer.

7.verse: In the day of my trouble I will call on you,

8.verse: There is no one like you among the gods, Lord,

9.verse: All nations you have made will come and worship before you, Lord.

10.verse: For you are great, and do wondrous things.

11.verse: Teach me your way, Yahweh.

12.verse: I will praise you, Lord my God, with my whole heart.

13.verse: For your loving kindness is great toward me.

14.verse: God, the proud have risen up against me.

15.verse: But you, Lord, are a merciful and gracious God,

16.verse: Turn to me, and have mercy on me!

17.verse: Show me a sign of your goodness,

1.verse: His foundation is in the holy mountains.

2.verse: Yahweh loves the gates of Zion more than all the dwellings of Jacob.

3.verse: Glorious things are spoken about you, city of God. Selah.

4.verse: I will record Rahab and Babylon among those who acknowledge me.

5.verse: Yes, of Zion it will be said, “This one and that one was born in her;”

6.verse: Yahweh will count, when he writes up the peoples,

7.verse: Those who sing as well as those who dance say,

1.verse: Yahweh, the God of my salvation,

2.verse: Let my prayer enter into your presence.

3.verse: For my soul is full of troubles.

4.verse: I am counted among those who go down into the pit.

5.verse: set apart among the dead,

6.verse: You have laid me in the lowest pit,

7.verse: Your wrath lies heavily on me.

8.verse: You have taken my friends from me.

9.verse: My eyes are dim from grief.

10.verse: Do you show wonders to the dead?

11.verse: Is your loving kindness declared in the grave?

12.verse: Are your wonders made known in the dark?

13.verse: But to you, Yahweh, I have cried.

14.verse: Yahweh, why do you reject my soul?

15.verse: I am afflicted and ready to die from my youth up.

16.verse: Your fierce wrath has gone over me.

17.verse: They came around me like water all day long.

18.verse: You have put lover and friend far from me,

1.verse: I will sing of the loving kindness of Yahweh forever.

2.verse: I indeed declare, “Love stands firm forever.

3.verse: “I have made a covenant with my chosen one,

4.verse: ‘I will establish your offspring forever,

5.verse: The heavens will praise your wonders, Yahweh,

6.verse: For who in the skies can be compared to Yahweh?

7.verse: a very awesome God in the council of the holy ones,

8.verse: Yahweh, God of Armies, who is a mighty one, like you?

9.verse: You rule the pride of the sea.

10.verse: You have broken Rahab in pieces, like one of the slain.

11.verse: The heavens are yours.

12.verse: You have created the north and the south.

13.verse: You have a mighty arm.

14.verse: Righteousness and justice are the foundation of your throne.

15.verse: Blessed are the people who learn to acclaim you.

16.verse: In your name they rejoice all day.

17.verse: For you are the glory of their strength.

18.verse: For our shield belongs to Yahweh,

19.verse: Then you spoke in vision to your saints,

20.verse: I have found David, my servant.

21.verse: with whom my hand shall be established.

22.verse: No enemy will tax him.

23.verse: I will beat down his adversaries before him,

24.verse: But my faithfulness and my loving kindness will be with him.

25.verse: I will set his hand also on the sea,

26.verse: He will call to me, ‘You are my Father,

27.verse: I will also appoint him my firstborn,

28.verse: I will keep my loving kindness for him forever more.

29.verse: I will also make his offspring endure forever,

30.verse: If his children forsake my law,

32.verse: then I will punish their sin with the rod,

33.verse: But I will not completely take my loving kindness from him,

34.verse: I will not break my covenant,

35.verse: Once I have sworn by my holiness,

37.verse: It will be established forever like the moon,

38.verse: But you have rejected and spurned.

39.verse: You have renounced the covenant of your servant.

40.verse: You have broken down all his hedges.

41.verse: All who pass by the way rob him.

42.verse: You have exalted the right hand of his adversaries.

43.verse: Yes, you turn back the edge of his sword,

45.verse: You have shortened the days of his youth.

47.verse: Remember how short my time is,

48.verse: What man is he who shall live and not see death,

49.verse: Lord, where are your former loving kindnesses,

50.verse: Remember, Lord, the reproach of your servants,

51.verse: With which your enemies have mocked, Yahweh,

1.verse: Lord, you have been our dwelling place for all generations.

2.verse: Before the mountains were born,

3.verse: You turn man to destruction, saying,

4.verse: For a thousand years in your sight are just like yesterday when it is past,

5.verse: You sweep them away as they sleep.

6.verse: In the morning it sprouts and springs up.

7.verse: For we are consumed in your anger.

8.verse: You have set our iniquities before you,

9.verse: For all our days have passed away in your wrath.

10.verse: The days of our years are seventy,

11.verse: Who knows the power of your anger,

12.verse: So teach us to count our days,

13.verse: Relent, Yahweh!

14.verse: Satisfy us in the morning with your loving kindness,

15.verse: Make us glad for as many days as you have afflicted us,

16.verse: Let your work appear to your servants,

17.verse: Let the favor of the Lord our God be on us.

1.verse: He who dwells in the secret place of the Most High

4.verse: He will cover you with his feathers.

5.verse: You shall not be afraid of the terror by night,

6.verse: nor of the pestilence that walks in darkness,

7.verse: A thousand may fall at your side,

8.verse: You will only look with your eyes,

9.verse: Because you have made Yahweh your refuge,

10.verse: no evil shall happen to you,

11.verse: For he will put his angels in charge of you,

1.verse: It is a good thing to give thanks to Yahweh,

2.verse: to proclaim your loving kindness in the morning,

3.verse: with the ten-stringed lute, with the harp,

6.verse: A senseless man doesn’t know,

7.verse: though the wicked spring up as the grass,

8.verse: But you, Yahweh, are on high forever more.

9.verse: For, behold, your enemies, Yahweh,

10.verse: But you have exalted my horn like that of the wild ox.

1.verse: Yahweh reigns!

2.verse: Your throne is established from long ago.

1.verse: Yahweh, you God to whom vengeance belongs,

2.verse: Rise up, you judge of the earth.

3.verse: Yahweh, how long will the wicked,

4.verse: They pour out arrogant words.

5.verse: They break your people in pieces, Yahweh,

6.verse: They kill the widow and the alien,

7.verse: They say, “Yah will not see,

8.verse: Consider, you senseless among the people;

9.verse: He who implanted the ear, won’t he hear?

10.verse: He who disciplines the nations, won’t he punish?

11.verse: Yahweh knows the thoughts of man,

12.verse: Blessed is the man whom you discipline, Yah,

13.verse: that you may give him rest from the days of adversity,

14.verse: For Yahweh won’t reject his people,

1.verse: Sing to Yahweh a new song!

1.verse: Sing to Yahweh a new song,

1.verse: I will sing of loving kindness and justice.

1.verse: Praise Yahweh, my soul!

1.verse: Bless Yahweh, my soul.

1.verse: Give thanks to Yahweh, for he is good,

1.verse: God of my praise, don’t remain silent,

8.verse: Let his days be few.

10.verse: Let his children be wandering beggars.

16.verse: because he didn’t remember to show kindness,

19.verse: Let it be to him as the clothing with which he covers himself,

21.verse: But deal with me, Yahweh the Lord, for your name’s sake,

22.verse: for I am poor and needy.

23.verse: I fade away like an evening shadow.

24.verse: My knees are weak through fasting.

25.verse: I have also become a reproach to them.

27.verse: that they may know that this is your hand;

1.verse: Blessed are those whose ways are blameless,

83.verse: For I have become like a wineskin in the smoke.

84.verse: How many are the days of your servant?

85.verse: The proud have dug pits for me,

86.verse: All of your commandments are faithful.

87.verse: They had almost wiped me from the earth,

88.verse: Preserve my life according to your loving kindness,

89.verse: Yahweh, your word is settled in heaven forever.

90.verse: Your faithfulness is to all generations.

91.verse: Your laws remain to this day,

92.verse: Unless your law had been my delight,

93.verse: I will never forget your precepts,

95.verse: The wicked have waited for me, to destroy me.

96.verse: I have seen a limit to all perfection,

98.verse: Your commandments make me wiser than my enemies,

99.verse: I have more understanding than all my teachers,

100.verse: I understand more than the aged,

101.verse: I have kept my feet from every evil way,

102.verse: I have not turned away from your ordinances,

103.verse: How sweet are your promises to my taste,

104.verse: Through your precepts, I get understanding;

105.verse: Your word is a lamp to my feet,

106.verse: I have sworn, and have confirmed it,

108.verse: Accept, I beg you, the willing offerings of my mouth.

109.verse: My soul is continually in my hand,

110.verse: The wicked have laid a snare for me,

111.verse: I have taken your testimonies as a heritage forever,

112.verse: I have set my heart to perform your statutes forever,

114.verse: You are my hiding place and my shield.

116.verse: Uphold me according to your word, that I may live.

117.verse: Hold me up, and I will be safe,

118.verse: You reject all those who stray from your statutes,

119.verse: You put away all the wicked of the earth like dross.

120.verse: My flesh trembles for fear of you.

121.verse: I have done what is just and righteous.

123.verse: My eyes fail looking for your salvation,

124.verse: Deal with your servant according to your loving kindness.

125.verse: I am your servant. Give me understanding,

126.verse: It is time to act, Yahweh,

127.verse: Therefore I love your commandments more than gold,

128.verse: Therefore I consider all of your precepts to be right.

130.verse: The entrance of your words gives light.

131.verse: I opened my mouth wide and panted,

132.verse: Turn to me, and have mercy on me,

133.verse: Establish my footsteps in your word.

134.verse: Redeem me from the oppression of man,

135.verse: Make your face shine on your servant.

136.verse: Streams of tears run down my eyes,

138.verse: You have commanded your statutes in righteousness.

140.verse: Your promises have been thoroughly tested,

142.verse: Your righteousness is an everlasting righteousness.

143.verse: Trouble and anguish have taken hold of me.

145.verse: I have called with my whole heart.

146.verse: I have called to you. Save me!

147.verse: I rise before dawn and cry for help.

148.verse: My eyes stay open through the night watches,

149.verse: Hear my voice according to your loving kindness.

150.verse: They draw near who follow after wickedness.

152.verse: Of old I have known from your testimonies,

153.verse: Consider my affliction, and deliver me,

154.verse: Plead my cause, and redeem me!

155.verse: Salvation is far from the wicked,

156.verse: Great are your tender mercies, Yahweh.

157.verse: Many are my persecutors and my adversaries.

158.verse: I look at the faithless with loathing,

159.verse: Consider how I love your precepts.

160.verse: All of your words are truth.

161.verse: Princes have persecuted me without a cause,

164.verse: Seven times a day, I praise you,

165.verse: Those who love your law have great peace.

166.verse: I have hoped for your salvation, Yahweh.

167.verse: My soul has observed your testimonies.

168.verse: I have obeyed your precepts and your testimonies,

169.verse: Let my cry come before you, Yahweh.

170.verse: Let my supplication come before you.

172.verse: Let my tongue sing of your word,

173.verse: Let your hand be ready to help me,

174.verse: I have longed for your salvation, Yahweh.

175.verse: Let my soul live, that I may praise you.

176.verse: I have gone astray like a lost sheep.

1.verse: In my distress, I cried to Yahweh.

2.verse: Deliver my soul, Yahweh, from lying lips,

3.verse: What will be given to you, and what will be done more to you,

4.verse: Sharp arrows of the mighty,

5.verse: Woe is me, that I live in Meshech,

6.verse: My soul has had her dwelling too long

7.verse: I am for peace,

1.verse: I will lift up my eyes to the hills.

2.verse: My help comes from Yahweh,

3.verse: He will not allow your foot to be moved.

4.verse: Behold, he who keeps Israel

5.verse: Yahweh is your keeper.

6.verse: The sun will not harm you by day,

7.verse: Yahweh will keep you from all evil.

8.verse: Yahweh will keep your going out and your coming in,

1.verse: I was glad when they said to me,

2.verse: Our feet are standing within your gates, Jerusalem,

3.verse: Jerusalem, that is built as a city that is compact together,

4.verse: where the tribes go up, even Yah’s tribes,

5.verse: For there are set thrones for judgment,

6.verse: Pray for the peace of Jerusalem.

7.verse: Peace be within your walls,

8.verse: For my brothers’ and companions’ sakes,

9.verse: For the sake of the house of Yahweh our God,

1.verse: I lift up my eyes to you,

2.verse: Behold, as the eyes of servants look to the hand of their master,

3.verse: Have mercy on us, Yahweh, have mercy on us,

4.verse: Our soul is exceedingly filled with the scoffing of those who are at ease,

1.verse: If it had not been Yahweh who was on our side,

2.verse: if it had not been Yahweh who was on our side,

3.verse: then they would have swallowed us up alive,

4.verse: then the waters would have overwhelmed us,

5.verse: then the proud waters would have gone over our soul.

6.verse: Blessed be Yahweh,

7.verse: Our soul has escaped like a bird out of the fowler’s snare.

8.verse: Our help is in Yahweh’s name,

1.verse: Those who trust in Yahweh are as Mount Zion,

2.verse: As the mountains surround Jerusalem,

3.verse: For the scepter of wickedness won’t remain over the allotment of the righteous;

4.verse: Do good, Yahweh, to those who are good,

5.verse: But as for those who turn away to their crooked ways,

1.verse: When Yahweh brought back those who returned to Zion,

2.verse: Then our mouth was filled with laughter,

3.verse: Yahweh has done great things for us,

4.verse: Restore our fortunes again, Yahweh,

5.verse: Those who sow in tears will reap in joy.

6.verse: He who goes out weeping, carrying seed for sowing,

1.verse: Unless Yahweh builds the house,

2.verse: It is vain for you to rise up early,

3.verse: Behold, children are a heritage of Yahweh.

4.verse: As arrows in the hand of a mighty man,

5.verse: Happy is the man who has his quiver full of them.

1.verse: Blessed is everyone who fears Yahweh,

2.verse: For you will eat the labor of your hands.

3.verse: Your wife will be as a fruitful vine in the innermost parts of your house,

4.verse: Behold, this is how the man who fears Yahweh is blessed.

5.verse: May Yahweh bless you out of Zion,

6.verse: Yes, may you see your children’s children.

1.verse: Many times they have afflicted me from my youth up.

2.verse: many times they have afflicted me from my youth up,

3.verse: The plowers plowed on my back.

4.verse: Yahweh is righteous.

5.verse: Let them be disappointed and turned backward,

6.verse: Let them be as the grass on the housetops,

7.verse: with which the reaper doesn’t fill his hand,

8.verse: Neither do those who go by say,

1.verse: Out of the depths I have cried to you, Yahweh.

2.verse: Lord, hear my voice.

3.verse: If you, Yah, kept a record of sins,

4.verse: But there is forgiveness with you,

5.verse: I wait for Yahweh.

6.verse: My soul longs for the Lord more than watchmen long for the morning,

7.verse: Israel, hope in Yahweh,

8.verse: He will redeem Israel from all their sins.

1.verse: Yahweh, my heart isn’t arrogant, nor my eyes lofty;

2.verse: Surely I have stilled and quieted my soul,

3.verse: Israel, hope in Yahweh,

1.verse: Yahweh, remember David and all his affliction,

2.verse: how he swore to Yahweh,

3.verse: “Surely I will not come into the structure of my house,

4.verse: I will not give sleep to my eyes,

5.verse: until I find out a place for Yahweh,

6.verse: Behold, we heard of it in Ephrathah.

7.verse: “We will go into his dwelling place.

8.verse: Arise, Yahweh, into your resting place,

9.verse: Let your priests be clothed with righteousness.

10.verse: For your servant David’s sake,

11.verse: Yahweh has sworn to David in truth.

12.verse: If your children will keep my covenant,

13.verse: For Yahweh has chosen Zion.

14.verse: “This is my resting place forever.

15.verse: I will abundantly bless her provision.

16.verse: I will also clothe her priests with salvation.

17.verse: I will make the horn of David to bud there.

18.verse: I will clothe his enemies with shame,

1.verse: See how good and how pleasant it is

2.verse: It is like the precious oil on the head,

3.verse: like the dew of Hermon,

1.verse: Look! Praise Yahweh, all you servants of Yahweh,

2.verse: Lift up your hands in the sanctuary.

3.verse: May Yahweh bless you from Zion,

1.verse: Praise Yah!

2.verse: you who stand in Yahweh’s house,

3.verse: Praise Yah, for Yahweh is good.

4.verse: For Yah has chosen Jacob for himself,

5.verse: For I know that Yahweh is great,

6.verse: Whatever Yahweh pleased, that he has done,

7.verse: He causes the clouds to rise from the ends of the earth.

8.verse: He struck the firstborn of Egypt,

9.verse: He sent signs and wonders into the middle of you, Egypt,

10.verse: He struck many nations,

11.verse: Sihon king of the Amorites,

12.verse: and gave their land for a heritage,

13.verse: Your name, Yahweh, endures forever;

14.verse: For Yahweh will judge his people

15.verse: The idols of the nations are silver and gold,

16.verse: They have mouths, but they can’t speak.

17.verse: They have ears, but they can’t hear,

18.verse: Those who make them will be like them,

19.verse: House of Israel, praise Yahweh!

20.verse: House of Levi, praise Yahweh!

21.verse: Blessed be Yahweh from Zion,

1.verse: Give thanks to Yahweh, for he is good;

2.verse: Give thanks to the God of gods;

3.verse: Give thanks to the Lord of lords;

4.verse: to him who alone does great wonders;

5.verse: to him who by understanding made the heavens;

6.verse: to him who spread out the earth above the waters;

7.verse: to him who made the great lights;

8.verse: the sun to rule by day;

9.verse: the moon and stars to rule by night;

10.verse: to him who struck down the Egyptian firstborn;

11.verse: and brought out Israel from among them;

12.verse: with a strong hand, and with an outstretched arm;

13.verse: to him who divided the Red Sea apart;

14.verse: and made Israel to pass through the middle of it;

15.verse: but overthrew Pharaoh and his army in the Red Sea;

16.verse: to him who led his people through the wilderness;

17.verse: to him who struck great kings;

18.verse: and killed mighty kings;

19.verse: Sihon king of the Amorites;

20.verse: Og king of Bashan;

21.verse: and gave their land as an inheritance;

22.verse: even a heritage to Israel his servant;

23.verse: who remembered us in our low estate;

24.verse: and has delivered us from our adversaries;

25.verse: who gives food to every creature;

26.verse: Oh give thanks to the God of heaven;

1.verse: By the rivers of Babylon, there we sat down.

2.verse: On the willows in that land,

3.verse: For there, those who led us captive asked us for songs.

4.verse: How can we sing Yahweh’s song in a foreign land?

5.verse: If I forget you, Jerusalem,

6.verse: Let my tongue stick to the roof of my mouth if I don’t remember you,

7.verse: Remember, Yahweh, against the children of Edom in the day of Jerusalem,

8.verse: Daughter of Babylon, doomed to destruction,

9.verse: Happy shall he be,

1.verse: I will give you thanks with my whole heart.

2.verse: I will bow down toward your holy temple,

3.verse: In the day that I called, you answered me.

4.verse: All the kings of the earth will give you thanks, Yahweh,

5.verse: Yes, they will sing of the ways of Yahweh,

6.verse: For though Yahweh is high, yet he looks after the lowly;

7.verse: Though I walk in the middle of trouble, you will revive me.

8.verse: Yahweh will fulfill that which concerns me.

1.verse: Yahweh, you have searched me,

2.verse: You know my sitting down and my rising up.

3.verse: You search out my path and my lying down,

4.verse: For there is not a word on my tongue,

5.verse: You hem me in behind and before.

6.verse: This knowledge is beyond me.

7.verse: Where could I go from your Spirit?

8.verse: If I ascend up into heaven, you are there.

9.verse: If I take the wings of the dawn,

10.verse: even there your hand will lead me,

11.verse: If I say, “Surely the darkness will overwhelm me.

12.verse: even the darkness doesn’t hide from you,

13.verse: For you formed my inmost being.

14.verse: I will give thanks to you,

15.verse: My frame wasn’t hidden from you,

16.verse: Your eyes saw my body.

17.verse: How precious to me are your thoughts, God!

18.verse: If I would count them, they are more in number than the sand.

19.verse: If only you, God, would kill the wicked.

20.verse: For they speak against you wickedly.

21.verse: Yahweh, don’t I hate those who hate you?

22.verse: I hate them with perfect hatred.

23.verse: Search me, God, and know my heart.

24.verse: See if there is any wicked way in me,

1.verse: Deliver me, Yahweh, from the evil man.

2.verse: those who devise mischief in their hearts.

3.verse: They have sharpened their tongues like a serpent.

4.verse: Yahweh, keep me from the hands of the wicked.

5.verse: The proud have hidden a snare for me,

6.verse: I said to Yahweh, “You are my God.”

7.verse: Yahweh, the Lord, the strength of my salvation,

8.verse: Yahweh, don’t grant the desires of the wicked.

9.verse: As for the head of those who surround me,

10.verse: Let burning coals fall on them.

11.verse: An evil speaker won’t be established in the earth.

12.verse: I know that Yahweh will maintain the cause of the afflicted,

13.verse: Surely the righteous will give thanks to your name.

1.verse: Yahweh, I have called on you.

2.verse: Let my prayer be set before you like incense;

3.verse: Set a watch, Yahweh, before my mouth.

4.verse: Don’t incline my heart to any evil thing,

5.verse: Let the righteous strike me, it is kindness;

6.verse: Their judges are thrown down by the sides of the rock.

7.verse: “As when one plows and breaks up the earth,

8.verse: For my eyes are on you, Yahweh, the Lord.

9.verse: Keep me from the snare which they have laid for me,

10.verse: Let the wicked fall together into their own nets

1.verse: I cry with my voice to Yahweh.

2.verse: I pour out my complaint before him.

3.verse: When my spirit was overwhelmed within me,

4.verse: Look on my right, and see;

5.verse: I cried to you, Yahweh.

6.verse: Listen to my cry,

7.verse: Bring my soul out of prison,

1.verse: Hear my prayer, Yahweh.

2.verse: Don’t enter into judgment with your servant,

3.verse: For the enemy pursues my soul.

4.verse: Therefore my spirit is overwhelmed within me.

5.verse: I remember the days of old.

6.verse: I spread out my hands to you.

7.verse: Hurry to answer me, Yahweh.

8.verse: Cause me to hear your loving kindness in the morning,

9.verse: Deliver me, Yahweh, from my enemies.

10.verse: Teach me to do your will,

11.verse: Revive me, Yahweh, for your name’s sake.

12.verse: In your loving kindness, cut off my enemies,

1.verse: Blessed be Yahweh, my rock,

2.verse: my loving kindness, my fortress,

3.verse: Yahweh, what is man, that you care for him?

4.verse: Man is like a breath.

5.verse: Part your heavens, Yahweh, and come down.

6.verse: Throw out lightning, and scatter them.

7.verse: Stretch out your hand from above,

8.verse: whose mouths speak deceit,

9.verse: I will sing a new song to you, God.

10.verse: You are he who gives salvation to kings,

11.verse: Rescue me, and deliver me out of the hands of foreigners,

12.verse: Then our sons will be like well-nurtured plants,

13.verse: Our barns are full, filled with all kinds of provision.

14.verse: Our oxen will pull heavy loads.

15.verse: Happy are the people who are in such a situation.

1.verse: I will exalt you, my God, the King.

2.verse: Every day I will praise you.

3.verse: Great is Yahweh, and greatly to be praised!

4.verse: One generation will commend your works to another,

5.verse: I will meditate on the glorious majesty of your honor,

6.verse: Men will speak of the might of your awesome acts.

7.verse: They will utter the memory of your great goodness,

8.verse: Yahweh is gracious, merciful,

9.verse: Yahweh is good to all.

10.verse: All your works will give thanks to you, Yahweh.

11.verse: They will speak of the glory of your kingdom,

12.verse: to make known to the sons of men his mighty acts,

13.verse: Your kingdom is an everlasting kingdom.

14.verse: Yahweh upholds all who fall,

15.verse: The eyes of all wait for you.

16.verse: You open your hand,

17.verse: Yahweh is righteous in all his ways,

18.verse: Yahweh is near to all those who call on him,

19.verse: He will fulfill the desire of those who fear him.

20.verse: Yahweh preserves all those who love him,

21.verse: My mouth will speak the praise of Yahweh.

1.verse: Praise Yah!

2.verse: While I live, I will praise Yahweh.

3.verse: Don’t put your trust in princes,

4.verse: His spirit departs, and he returns to the earth.

5.verse: Happy is he who has the God of Jacob for his help,

6.verse: who made heaven and earth,

7.verse: who executes justice for the oppressed;

8.verse: Yahweh opens the eyes of the blind.

9.verse: Yahweh preserves the foreigners.

10.verse: Yahweh will reign forever;

1.verse: Praise Yah,

2.verse: Yahweh builds up Jerusalem.

3.verse: He heals the broken in heart,

4.verse: He counts the number of the stars.

5.verse: Great is our Lord, and mighty in power.

6.verse: Yahweh upholds the humble.

7.verse: Sing to Yahweh with thanksgiving.

8.verse: who covers the sky with clouds,

9.verse: He provides food for the livestock,

10.verse: He doesn’t delight in the strength of the horse.

11.verse: Yahweh takes pleasure in those who fear him,

12.verse: Praise Yahweh, Jerusalem!

13.verse: For he has strengthened the bars of your gates.

14.verse: He makes peace in your borders.

15.verse: He sends out his commandment to the earth.

16.verse: He gives snow like wool,

17.verse: He hurls down his hail like pebbles.

18.verse: He sends out his word, and melts them.

19.verse: He shows his word to Jacob,

20.verse: He has not done this for just any nation.

1.verse: Praise Yah!

2.verse: Praise him, all his angels!

3.verse: Praise him, sun and moon!

4.verse: Praise him, you heavens of heavens,

5.verse: Let them praise Yahweh’s name,

6.verse: He has also established them forever and ever.

7.verse: Praise Yahweh from the earth,

8.verse: lightning and hail, snow and clouds;

9.verse: mountains and all hills;

10.verse: wild animals and all livestock;

11.verse: kings of the earth and all peoples;

12.verse: both young men and maidens;

13.verse: let them praise Yahweh’s name,

14.verse: He has lifted up the horn of his people,

1.verse: Praise Yahweh!

2.verse: Let Israel rejoice in him who made them.

3.verse: Let them praise his name in the dance!

4.verse: For Yahweh takes pleasure in his people.

5.verse: Let the saints rejoice in honor.

6.verse: May the high praises of God be in their mouths,

7.verse: to execute vengeance on the nations,

8.verse: to bind their kings with chains,

9.verse: to execute on them the written judgment.

1.verse: Praise Yah!

2.verse: Praise him for his mighty acts!

3.verse: Praise him with the sounding of the trumpet!

4.verse: Praise him with tambourine and dancing!

5.verse: Praise him with loud cymbals!

6.verse: Let everything that has breath praise Yah!
